FuncDef:
The e1 set clock command sets a clock mode for an E1 channel.
The undo e1 set clock command restores the default setting.
By default, the clock mode of an E1 channel is master.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the E1 channel number of a CPOS interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 63.

Indicates the recovery domain of an upstream CES ACR clock.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8.

Indicates the advertisement domain of an upstream CES ACR clock.
For an 8-port interface card, domain-value for the former four ports is an integer ranging from 1 to 16 and for the latter four ports is an integer ranging from 17 to 32.

ExtraInfo:
The clock modes of different E1 channels on the same CPOS interface are independent of each other.
When interfaces on two devices are directly connected, one E1 channel must be configured to work in master clock mode and use internal clock signals, and the other E1 channel must be configured to work in slave clock mode and use line clock signals.
